page.title: 13Legends of Westhill.
page.content:
There are many interesting{Stories } {and legends}of Westhill.One of these concerns Malcolm Gillespie who had the job of catching people who made illegal whisky. But in 1827 he was publicly hanged for forgery and was the last person publicly executed in Aberdeen.
Another interesting legend is about how Westhill got its name.Alexander Smith owned an area called Blackhills and his brother owned property called Wester Kinmundy.But when both men died both properties were bought but the new owner disliked the names.He therefore he took the west from Wester Kinmundy and the hill from Blackhills and thats how Westhill got its name.
